CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, October 21, 1961, pg. 10 reads: "To Elevate Standards - This group of Herron Hill Junior High School students, known as the Junior Misses and Junior Courtiers, was organized for the purpose of raising the standards of youth by setting examples, morally, spiritually, socially and intellectually. Mrs. Mamie H. Wadkins, first row, center, is the organizer and sponsor of the group, which worshiped at Calvary Baptist Church last Sunday morning.  The Rev. J.A. Cox, host pastor, is at the left of Mrs. Wadkins.  Young officers include Janet Moore, Cathy Hord, Monnie Keith, Jaynetta [Junyetta] Jelks, Chenits Pettigrew, Gary Griggs, Steven Horne and James Stewart. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of the Junior Misses and Junior Courtiersmen from Herron Hill Junior High School, including Janet Moore, Cathy Hord, Monnie Keith, Junyetta Jelks, Chenits Pettigrew, Gary Griggs, Steven Horne and James Stewart; with sponsors Rev. J.A. Cox and Mamie H. Wadkins, first row, center, posed in front of altar in Calvary Baptist Church, another version
